required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ethanol and Cannabinoid Effects on Simulated Driving and Related Cognition
clinical_study.official_title: Ethanol and Cannabinoid Effects on Simulated Driving and Related Cognition

brief_summary.textblock: The overarching goal of this study is to characterize the effects of ethanol and cannabinoids on simulated driving and related cognition.

detailed_description.textblock: To study the effects of ethanol clamped at BAC 0.04% and THC (1.05 mg in a 70 kg individual) on driving.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180 mins after start of alcohol and THC infusion
primary_outcome.description: changes in road tracking errors between timepoints to assess the effects of alcohol and THC on road tracking errors.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180, +240 mins after start of alcohol and THC infusion
secondary_outcome.description: A scale designed to assess the stimulant and sedative effects associated with alcohol intoxication.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180 mins after start of alcohol and THC infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Feeling states associated with alcohol and cannabis intoxication will be measured using this self-report scale of feeling states.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: +40 mins after start of alcohol and THC infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Several computer tasks will be administered to assess alcohol and THC effects on driving related cognition, including: visual vigilance, visual motor function, attention and working memory, and processing speed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180 mins after start of alcohol and THC infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to rate their willingness to drive at their current state in the context of various scenarios including willingness to drive from testing facility to a number of destinations that are different driving distances.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180 mins after start of alcohol and THC infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to rate the number of standard joints that they believe they have been administered.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: baseline, +20, +50, +120, +180 mins after start of alcohol and THC infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to rate the number of standard drinks that they believe they have been administered.

clinical_study.condition: Driving Under the Influence of Alcohol and Other Drugs

intervention.description: Low dose (0.015 mg/kg = 1.05 mg in a 70 kg individual) THC, dissolved in alcohol. This dose is roughly equivalent to smoking approximately 1/4 of a marijuana cigarette, or "joint". Administered over 20 minutes.
Control: small amount of alcohol (quarter teaspoon), with no THC. Administered over 20 minutes.

Target BrAC of 0.04% reached over 20 minutes and then clamped to maintain this dose for an additional 60 minutes. This dose is equivalent to consuming approximately 2 drinks over 1 hour. Administered over a total of 80 minutes.
Control: no alcohol, administered for a total of 80 minutes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males or females 21 to 55 years of age (extremes included).
- Exposed to cannabis at least once.
- Exposed to alcohol at least once.
- Able to provide informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cannabis naive.
- Alcohol naive.
- Positive pregnancy screen
- Hearing deficits.

facility.name: Biological Studies Unit, VA Connecticut Healthcare System
